sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations using matrix methods
message_1:
Solve the system of linear equations using matrix methods:

$x+y+z=7$

$2x-3y+2z=0$

$-3x+4y+z=6$
message_2:
To solve the system of linear equations using matrix methods, we'll first write the given system in the matrix form AX = B, where A is the matrix of coefficients, X is the column matrix of variables, and B is the column matrix of constants.

A = $\begin{bmatrix} 1 & 1 & 1 \\ 2 & -3 & 2 \\ -3 & 4 & 1 \end{bmatrix}$, X = $\begin{bmatrix} x \\ y \\ z \end{bmatrix}$, and B = $\begin{bmatrix} 7 \\ 0 \\ 6 \end{bmatrix}$

Now, we'll find the inverse of matrix A (A_inv) and then multiply it with matrix B to get the values of x, y, and z.

A_inv = $\frac{1}{\text{det}(A)} \cdot \text{adj}(A)$

First, let's find the determinant of A (det(A)):

det(A) = $\begin{vmatrix} 1 & 1 & 1 \\ 2 & -3 & 2 \\ -3 & 4 & 1 \end{vmatrix} = 1\begin{vmatrix} -3 & 2 \\ 4 & 1 \end{vmatrix} - 1\begin{vmatrix} 2 & 2 \\ -3 & 1 \end{vmatrix} + 1\begin{vmatrix} 2 & -3 \\ -3 & 4 \end{vmatrix}$

det(A) = $1((-3)(1) - (2)(4)) - 1((2)(1) - (2)(-3)) + 1((2)(4) - (-3)(-3))$

det(A) = $1(-3 - 8) - 1(2 + 6) + 1(8 - 9)$

det(A) = $-11 - 8 - 1 = -20$

Now, let's find the adjoint of A (adj(A)):

adj(A) = $\begin{bmatrix} \begin{vmatrix} -3 & 2 \\ 4 & 1 \end{vmatrix} & -\begin{vmatrix} 2 & 2 \\ -3 & 1 \end{vmatrix} & \begin{vmatrix} 2 & -3 \\ -3 & 4 \end{vmatrix} \\ -\begin{vmatrix} 1 & 1 \\ -3 & 4 \end{vmatrix} & \begin{vmatrix} 1 & 1 \\ 2 & 1 \end{vmatrix} & -\begin{vmatrix} 1 & 1 \\ 2 & -3 \end{vmatrix} \\ \begin{vmatrix} 1 & 1 \\ 2 & -3 \end{vmatrix} & -\begin{vmatrix} 1 & 1 \\ -3 & 4 \end{vmatrix} & \begin{vmatrix} 1 & 1 \\ 2 & -3 \end{vmatrix} \end{bmatrix}$

adj(A) = $\begin{bmatrix} (-3)(1) - (2)(4) & -((2)(1) - (2)(-3)) & (2)(4) - (-3)(-3) \\ -((1)(4) - (1)(-3)) & (1)(1) - (1)(2) & -((1)(-3) - (1)(2)) \\ (1)(-3) - (1)(2) & -((1)(4) - (1)(-3)) & (1)(1) - (1)(2) \end{bmatrix}$

adj(A) = $\begin{bmatrix} -11 & 8 & -1 \\ 7 & -1 & 5 \\ -5 & 7 & -1 \end{bmatrix}$

Now, let's find the inverse of A (A_inv):

A_inv = $\frac{1}{\text{det}(A)} \cdot \text{adj}(A) = \frac{1}{-20} \cdot \begin{bmatrix} -11 & 8 & -1 \\ 7 & -1 & 5 \\ -5 & 7 & -1 \end{bmatrix}$

A_inv = $\begin{bmatrix} \frac{11}{20} & -\frac{2}{5} & \frac{1}{20} \\ -\frac{7}{20} & \frac{1}{20} & -\frac{1}{4} \\ \frac{1}{4} & -\frac{7}{20} & \frac{1}{20} \end{bmatrix}$

Now, we'll multiply A_inv with B to get the values of x, y, and z:

X = A_inv * B = $\begin{bmatrix} \frac{11}{20} & -\frac{2}{5} & \frac{1}{20} \\ -\frac{7}{20} & \frac{1}{20} & -\frac{1}{4} \\ \frac{1}{4} & -\frac{7}{20} & \frac{1}{20} \end{bmatrix} \cdot \begin{bmatrix} 7 \\ 0 \\ 6 \end{bmatrix}$

X = $\begin{bmatrix} \frac{11}{20}(7) - \frac{2}{5}(0) + \frac{1}{20}(6) \\ -\frac{7}{20}(7) + \frac{1}{20}(0) - \frac{1}{4}(6) \\ \frac{1}{4}(7) - \frac{7}{20}(0) + \frac{1}{20}(6) \end{bmatrix}$

X = $\begin{bmatrix} \frac{77}{20} + \frac{3}{10} \\ -\frac{49}{20} - \frac{3}{2} \\ \frac{7}{4} + \frac{3}{20} \end{bmatrix}$

X = $\begin{bmatrix} 4 \\ -1 \\ 2 \end{bmatrix}$

So, the solution to the system of linear equations is x = 4, y = -1, and z = 2.
